Here it is like this:🔽In front, one should worship the guru and the buddhas and meditate on all phenomena as selfless.🔽These migrating beings are the magic of mind;🔽they do not exist elsewhere.🔽Having contemplated that with the mind, one should recite:

translated: The line “arousing him with the sound of the vajra” and so forth is stated for the generation of Vajrasattva.

original: bas zhes bya ba ni 'phar ma mang ba'i phyir dkyil 'khor thams cad ni rdo rje sems
analyzed: bas zhes bya ba ni 'phar ma mang ba'i phyir dkyil 'khor thams cad ni rdo rje sems
translated: The line “through the application of the great maṇḍala” means that all maṇḍalas are the maṇḍala of Vajrasattva because they have many platforms.

original: dpa'i dkyil 'khor ro/_/de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o/_/de la dang por
analyzed: dpa'i dkyil 'khor ro/_/de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o/_/de la dang por
translated: The line “in the center of that” and so forth is stated for the generation of Vajrasattva.

original: rang gi snying gar dbyangs kyi dang po las skyes pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la hum
analyzed: rang gi snying gar dbyangs kyi dang po las skyes pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la hum
translated: At one’s heart is a moon mandala arisen from the first vowel [oṃ], upon which is hūṃ.

original: bsgom par bya'o/_/de'i 'od zer rnams kyis mdun du bla ma dang rdo rje sems🔽dpa' dmigs pa la me tog la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod pa dang /_sngon du
analyzed: bsgom par bya'o/_/de'i 'od zer rnams kyis mdun du bla ma dang rdo rje sems dpa' dmigs pa la me tog la sogs pa rnams kyis mchod pa dang /_sngon du
translated: Light rays from that invoke the guru and Vajrasattva in the space in front.

original: sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa dang /_tshhangs pa'i  gnas bzhi yid la
analyzed: sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa dang /_tshhangs pa'i  gnas bzhi yid la
translated: Make offerings with flowers and so forth, confess previous misdeeds, and so forth, and bring to mind the four abodes of Brahmā.

original: gzugs te/_chos thams cad bdag med par byas nas/_om a d+ya nut+pan+na/🔽sarba d+harma_pra kr-i ti pra b+ha swa rahsarba d+harma_zhes bzlas shing /_de nyid rang bzhin
analyzed: gzugs te/_chos thams cad bdag med par byas nas/_om a d+ya nut+pan+na/ sarba d+harma_pra kr-i ti pra b+ha swa rahsarba d+harma_zhes bzlas shing /_de nyid rang bzhin
translated: Having made all phenomena selfless, recite oṃ āḥ hūṃ and oṃ āḥ hūṃ.🔽Then, imagine that the guru and Vajrasattva melt into light and dissolve into the hūṃ.🔽Then, imagine that the hūṃ dissolves into the moon mandala.🔽Then, imagine that the moon mandala also dissolves into one’s mind.

original: gyis 'od gsal ba'i sems zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par bsgom par bya'o/_/🔽om tshit+ta pra ti bya b+ham ka ro mi zhes yid kyis sngags brjod cing /_de nas yang zla
analyzed: gyis 'od gsal ba'i sems zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par bsgom par bya'o/_/🔽om tshit+ta pra ti bya b+ham ka ro mi zhes yid kyis sngags brjod cing /_de nas yang zla
translated: Then, imagine that one’s mind becomes the nature of the emptiness of the great emptiness.🔽Then, imagine that the emptiness of the great emptiness becomes the nature of the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽Then, imagine that the emptiness of the ultimate becomes the nature of the emptiness of all phenomena.🔽Then, imagine that the emptiness of all phenomena becomes the nature of the emptiness of the unobservable.🔽Then, imagine that the emptiness of the unobservable becomes the nature of the emptiness of the inherent nature.🔽Then, imagine that the emptiness of the inherent nature becomes the nature of the emptiness of the compounded.🔽Then, imagine that the emptiness of the compounded becomes the nature of the emptiness of the uncompounded.🔽Then, imagine that the emptiness of the uncompounded becomes the nature of the emptiness of the limitless.🔽Then, imagine that the emptiness of the limitless becomes the nature of the emptiness of the beginningless and endless.🔽Then, imagine that the emptiness of the beginningless and endless becomes the nature of the emptiness of the non-abandoned.🔽Then, imagine that the emptiness of the non-abandoned becomes the nature of the emptiness of the nature.🔽Then, imagine that the emptiness of the nature becomes the nature of the emptiness of all phenomena.🔽Then, imagine that the emptiness of all phenomena becomes the nature of the emptiness of the inherent nature.🔽Then, imagine that the emptiness of the inherent nature becomes the nature of the emptiness of the unobservable.🔽Then, imagine that the emptiness of the unobservable becomes the nature of the emptiness of all phenomena.🔽Then, imagine that the emptiness of all phenomena becomes the nature of the emptiness of the ultimate.🔽Then, imagine that the emptiness of the ultimate becomes the nature of the emptiness of the

original: ba'i dkyil 'khor rnam par bsgom par bya'o/_/om bo d+hi tshit+ta mut+tha da ya mi zhes🔽sngags brjod cing gong mar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la a la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi
analyzed: ba'i dkyil 'khor rnam par bsgom par bya'o/_/om bo d+hi tshit+ta mut+tha da ya mi zhes sngags brjod cing gong mar zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la a la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi
translated: Recite the mantra oṃ bodhicittamutpādayāmi.🔽The qualities of the buddhas enter the moon maṇḍala with the a and so on.

original: yon tan zhugs par bya'o/_/de bzhin du gnyis par ka la sogs pa bsgom par
analyzed: yon tan zhugs par bya'o/_/de bzhin du gnyis par ka la sogs pa bsgom par
translated: Similarly, meditate on the ka and so on in the second maṇḍala.

original: bya zhing /_de'i steng du hum las byung ba'i rdo rje dkar po'i lte ba la de byin gyis
analyzed: bya zhing /_de'i steng du hum las byung ba'i rdo rje dkar po'i lte ba la de byin gyis
translated: Above that, the white vajra arises from hūṃ.🔽Bless and imagine that.

original: brlab cing bsams nas/_om tish+tha badzra zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis byin gyis
analyzed: brlab cing bsams nas/_om tish+tha badzra zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis byin gyis
translated: Bless with the mantra oṃ tiṣṭha vajra.

original: brlab pa byas nas/_de nas bdag nyid rdo rjer bsgom par bya'o/_/om badzra
analyzed: brlab pa byas nas/_de nas bdag nyid rdo rjer bsgom par bya'o/_/om badzra
translated: Then, meditate on oneself as the vajra.

original: at+ma ko ham zhes brjod par bya'o/_/de dag thams cad yongs su gyur pas 'dzum
analyzed: at+ma ko ham zhes brjod par bya'o/_/de dag thams cad yongs su gyur pas 'dzum
translated: Recite oṃ vajra ātmāko ’haṃ.

original: zhing zla ba'i kha dog dang nyi ma'i 'od kyis dkyil 'khor dang sangs rgyas lnga'i
analyzed: zhing zla ba'i kha dog dang nyi ma'i 'od kyis dkyil 'khor dang sangs rgyas lnga'i
translated: All of those completely transform into a smiling, moon-colored, sun-radiant vajra.

original: dbu rgyan dang rgyan thams cad dang /_spyan gsum pa ral pa 'dzin pa dkar po
analyzed: dbu rgyan dang rgyan thams cad dang /_spyan gsum pa ral pa 'dzin pa dkar po
translated: He has a crown and all the ornaments, three eyes, and holds a lock of hair, which is white,

original: dang dkar po ma yin pa dang ser po dang dmar po dang rtsha ba dang g.yas pa dang / g.yon pa'i zhal bzhi ni zhi ba ste/_g.yas pa'i zhal ni zhi ba'i phyir/_/rtsha
analyzed: dang dkar po ma yin pa dang ser po dang dmar po dang rtsha ba dang g.yas pa dang / g.yon pa'i zhal bzhi ni zhi ba ste/_g.yas pa'i zhal ni zhi ba'i phyir/_/rtsha
translated: not white, yellow, red, and black. His four faces—right, left, front, and back—are peaceful,

original: ba dang g.yon pa dang rgyab kyi zhal ni gtshigs pa'i phyir ro/_/sum cu rtsha gsum
analyzed: ba dang g.yon pa dang rgyab kyi zhal ni gtshigs pa'i phyir ro/_/sum cu rtsha gsum
translated: because the right face is peaceful. The left, back, and front faces are wrathful.

original: pa 'jigs par mdzad pa rdo rje dang /_ral gri dang dril bu dang /_thod pa
analyzed: pa 'jigs par mdzad pa rdo rje dang /_ral gri dang dril bu dang /_thod pa
translated: The thirty-three-faced one is the terrifying one. He holds a vajra, sword, bell, and skull

original: g.yas pa dang g.yon pa'i phyag bzhi yis 'dzin pa thod par gnas pa'i zla ba'i🔽dkyil 'khor la bzhugs pa skyil krung phyed pa'i gar gyi gnas pa/_'chad par
analyzed: g.yas pa dang g.yon pa'i phyag bzhi yis 'dzin pa thod par gnas pa'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor la bzhugs pa skyil krung phyed pa'i gar gyi gnas pa/_'chad par
translated: cup with his four right and left hands. He stands in the center of a moon disc🔽in a skull cup. He is in the half-crossed posture of dance. He resides in the

original: 'gyur ba'i gzhal med khang du bzhugs shing dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams dang bcas
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i gzhal med khang du bzhugs shing dkyil 'khor gyi lha rnams dang bcas
translated: explained celestial palace together with the deities of the mandala.

original: par myur bar bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpa'i gzugs su bsgom par bya'o/_/de
analyzed: par myur bar bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpa'i gzugs su bsgom par bya'o/_/de
translated: One should quickly meditate on oneself as having the form of Vajrasattva.

original: nas hum yongs su gyur pa las nyi mar gnas pa'i rdo rje'i lte bar des byin gyis
analyzed: nas hum yongs su gyur pa las nyi mar gnas pa'i rdo rje'i lte bar des byin gyis
translated: The barley becomes a hūṃ, which completely transforms into a sun, in the center of which is a vajra marked with that [hūṃ].

original: brlabs nas/_de'i 'od zer rnams kyis rdo rje ra ba la sogs pa bsam mo/_/
analyzed: brlabs nas/_de'i 'od zer rnams kyis rdo rje ra ba la sogs pa bsam mo/_/
translated: Bless it with that [hūṃ], and imagine that its light rays create the vajra fence, and so on.

original: de la hum sum hum rdzogs pa dang ri rab kyi steng du chos kyi 'byung gnas so/_/de la
analyzed: de la hum sum hum rdzogs pa dang ri rab kyi steng du chos kyi 'byung gnas so/_/de la
translated: In that [palace], the hūṃ becomes a suṃ, and the hūṃ is complete. Upon Sumeru is the source of phenomena.

original: sna tshhogs pad+ma rdo rje'i steng du rgyu yongs su gyur pa'i rnam par snang mdzad do/_/
analyzed: sna tshhogs pad+ma rdo rje'i steng du rgyu yongs su gyur pa'i rnam par snang mdzad do/_/
translated: Upon that is a multicolored lotus and vajra, upon which the causal transformation is Vairocana.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las gru bzhi pa la sogs pa dang ldan par so sor thod pa'i🔽gdan gyis mnan par khang pa rtsheg ma bsam par bya ste/_rdo rje sems dpa'i
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las gru bzhi pa la sogs pa dang ldan par so sor thod pa'i gdan gyis mnan par khang pa rtsheg ma bsam par bya ste/_rdo rje sems dpa'i
translated: That completely transforms into a square celestial mansion with four doors, which is suppressed by individual skull platforms.

original: rnal 'byor pa de'i dbus  su pad+ma'i steng du zla bar gnas pa'i thod pa la zla ba'i
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa de'i dbus  su pad+ma'i steng du zla bar gnas pa'i thod pa la zla ba'i
translated: The vajra-being practitioner should imagine that in the center of that, upon a lotus and moon, is a skull cup with a moon mandala.

original: dkyil 'khor bltas nas 'di la a la sogs pa yang zhugs shing sangs rgyas la
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bltas nas 'di la a la sogs pa yang zhugs shing sangs rgyas la
translated: Looking at that, the vowels such as a and so on enter into it and transform into the complete form of a buddha.

original: sogs pa yang bsam par bya'o/_/om tshit+ta pra ti bya sgo ka ro mi zhes byin gyis
analyzed: sogs pa yang bsam par bya'o/_/om tshit+ta pra ti bya sgo ka ro mi zhes byin gyis
translated: Bless it.

original: brlab par bya'o/_/de bzhin du zla ba gnyis pa bsams la/_om bo d+hi tshit+ta
analyzed: brlab par bya'o/_/de bzhin du zla ba gnyis pa bsams la/_om bo d+hi tshit+ta
translated: Likewise, imagine a second moon, and om bodhicitta🔽vajra dakini

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i rnam par 'grel pa'i bshad sbyar zhes bya ba
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i rnam par 'grel pa'i bshad sbyar zhes bya ba
translated: Vajra Dakini Commentary🔽mudra dayami

original: mud+da da ya mi zhes byin gyis brlabs shing /_hum gi sa bon yongs su gyur pa las
analyzed: mud+da da ya mi zhes byin gyis brlabs shing /_hum gi sa bon yongs su gyur pa las
translated: Bless it. The seed syllable hum completely transforms into

original: rdo rje'i lte bar des byin gyis brlabs cing blta bar bya'o/_/om tish+tha badzra zhes
analyzed: rdo rje'i lte bar des byin gyis brlabs cing blta bar bya'o/_/om tish+tha badzra zhes
translated: a vajra. In the center of the vajra, bless it and visualize it.🔽Om tishtha vajra

original: byin gyis brlabs la/_de nas bdag nyid rdo rje tsham du shes par byas nas/
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs la/_de nas bdag nyid rdo rje tsham du shes par byas nas/
translated: Bless it. Then, having recognized oneself as the vajra,🔽Om vajra ratna koham🔽Bless it. Then, om maha sukha vajra satva

original: om badzrat+na ko ham zhes byin gyis brlab par bya'o/_/de nas om ma ha su kha badzra satwa
analyzed: om badzrat+na ko ham zhes byin gyis brlab par bya'o/_/de nas om ma ha su kha badzra satwa
translated: Jhah hum bam hoh🔽Surasta

original: dzahhum bam hoh_su ra ta ste  zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis rang gi sems kyi rnam par rtog
analyzed: dzahhum bam hoh_su ra ta ste  zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis rang gi sems kyi rnam par rtog
translated: With this mantra, one’s mind is visualized as a moon.

original: pa las bzhengs par bskul zhing de dag thams cad rdzogs pa dang rdo rje sems🔽dpa' gong du gsungs pa'i gzugs su bdag nyid bsam par bya'o/_/om ya tha
analyzed: pa las bzhengs par bskul zhing de dag thams cad rdzogs pa dang rdo rje sems dpa' gong du gsungs pa'i gzugs su bdag nyid bsam par bya'o/_/om ya tha
translated: Then, having been roused from that state, one should imagine that all of those [vajras] are complete and that one is Vajrasattva in the form described above.

original: sarba ta tha ga ta sta tha ham zhes byin gyis brlabs te mngon par byang chub pa lnga'i
analyzed: sarba ta tha ga ta sta tha ham zhes byin gyis brlabs te mngon par byang chub pa lnga'i
translated: With “oṃ yaṃ tāṃ🔽ghaṃ,” one should bless oneself.

original: rnam pa rdzogs pa'o/_/om ha zhes bya ba 'dis ni rdo rje sems dpa' ni snying khar🔽ro/_/na mah_hi zhes bya ba 'dis ni rnam par snang mdzad spyi bo la'o/_/swa ha hu
analyzed: rnam pa rdzogs pa'o/_/om ha zhes bya ba 'dis ni rdo rje sems dpa' ni snying khar ro/_/na mah_hi zhes bya ba 'dis ni rnam par snang mdzad spyi bo la'o/_/swa ha hu
translated: With “oṃ haṃ,” Vajrasattva is at the heart.🔽  With “naṃ hīṃ,” Vairocana is at the crown.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni pad+ma gar gyi dbang phyug ste kha la'o/_/bo shat he zhes bya ba🔽'dis ni he ru ka ste dpung pa la'o/_/hum hum ho zhes bya ba 'dis ni rdo rje nyi ma ste
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni pad+ma gar gyi dbang phyug ste kha la'o/_/bo shat he zhes bya ba 'dis ni he ru ka ste dpung pa la'o/_/hum hum ho zhes bya ba 'dis ni rdo rje nyi ma ste
translated: With “svā hāṃ,” Padmanarteśvara is at the mouth.🔽  With “voṣṭa he,” Heruka is at the shoulders.🔽  With “huṃ huṃ ho,” Vajrasūrya is at the two eyes.

original: mig gnyis la'o/_/phat ham zhes bya ba 'dis ni rta mchog ste yan lag thams cad
analyzed: mig gnyis la'o/_/phat ham zhes bya ba 'dis ni rta mchog ste yan lag thams cad
translated: With “phaṭ haṃ,” Hayagrīva is at all the limbs.

original: la mtshhon cha'o/_/'di rnams kyi sku mdog dang phyag mtshhan la sogs pa ni 'di🔽nyid du dkyil 'khor du bshad par bya'o/_/om bam zhes bya ba 'dis ni rdo rje phag
analyzed: la mtshhon cha'o/_/'di rnams kyi sku mdog dang phyag mtshhan la sogs pa ni 'di nyid du dkyil 'khor du bshad par bya'o/_/om bam zhes bya ba 'dis ni rdo rje phag
translated: The colors of their bodies, hand implements, and so on will be explained in the mandala below.🔽Om bam is Vajra Varahi, at the navel.

original: mo ste lte ba la'o/_/om ham yo zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'gro byed ma ste snying la'o/_/om
analyzed: mo ste lte ba la'o/_/om ham yo zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'gro byed ma ste snying la'o/_/om
translated: Om ham yo is Jagadhatri, at the heart.

original: grogs mo zhes bya ba 'dis ni rmongs byed ma ste kha la'o/_/om hri _hri zhes bya ba 'dis🔽ni skyong byed ma ste spyi bo la'o/_/om hum hum zhes bya ba 'dis ni skrag byed ma ste spyi
analyzed: grogs mo zhes bya ba 'dis ni rmongs byed ma ste kha la'o/_/om hri _hri zhes bya ba 'dis ni skyong byed ma ste spyi bo la'o/_/om hum hum zhes bya ba 'dis ni skrag byed ma ste spyi
translated: Om mitra is Mohini, at the mouth.🔽Om hri hri is Gopika, at the crown.🔽Om hum hum is Bhayani, at the forehead.

original: gtshug tu'o/_/om phat phat zhes bya ba 'dis ni gtum mo'i sgyu ste yan lag🔽thams cad la mtshhon cha'o/_/'di rnams kyi sku mdog la sogs pa ni le'u gzhan du
analyzed: gtshug tu'o/_/om phat phat zhes bya ba 'dis ni gtum mo'i sgyu ste yan lag thams cad la mtshhon cha'o/_/'di rnams kyi sku mdog la sogs pa ni le'u gzhan du
translated: Om phat phat is Chandika, at all the limbs.🔽The colors of their bodies and so on will be known in another chapter.

original: shes par bya'o/_/gzugs kyi phung po ni rnam par snang mdzad do/_/tshhor ba la
analyzed: shes par bya'o/_/gzugs kyi phung po ni rnam par snang mdzad do/_/tshhor ba la
translated: The aggregate of form is Vairocana.🔽The element of fire is Lochana.

original: rdo rje nyi ma'o/_/'du shes la pad+ma gar gyi dbang phyug go/_/'du byed la rta
analyzed: rdo rje nyi ma'o/_/'du shes la pad+ma gar gyi dbang phyug go/_/'du byed la rta
translated: Vajra Sun is in the aggregate of form. Lotus Lord of Dance is in the aggregate of perception.🔽Supreme Horse is in the aggregate of formation.

original: mchog go/_/rnam par shes pa'i phung po la dpal he ru ka'o/_/skye mched
analyzed: mchog go/_/rnam par shes pa'i phung po la dpal he ru ka'o/_/skye mched
translated: Glorious Heruka is in the aggregate of consciousness.

original: thams cad la rdo rje sems dpa'o/_/sa la ni spyan no/_/chu la ni ma ma ki'o/_/
analyzed: thams cad la rdo rje sems dpa'o/_/sa la ni spyan no/_/chu la ni ma ma ki'o/_/
translated: Vajrasattva is in all the sense bases. Locana is in earth. Mamaki is in water.🔽Pāṇḍaravāsinī is in fire. Tārā is in wind.

original: me la ni gos dkar ma'o/_/rlung la ni sgrol ma'o/_/nam mkha' la ni pad+ma
analyzed: me la ni gos dkar ma'o/_/rlung la ni sgrol ma'o/_/nam mkha' la ni pad+ma
translated: Blazing Lotus is in space.

original: 'bar ma'o/_/'di rnams kyi sku mdog la sogs pa'ang 'di nyid las dkyil
analyzed: 'bar ma'o/_/'di rnams kyi sku mdog la sogs pa'ang 'di nyid las dkyil
translated: Their colors and so on should be described in the mandala of this very [tantra].

original: 'khor du brjod par bya'o/_/pad+ma 'bar ma ni ma ma ki lta bu'o/_/go cha la🔽sogs par byin gyis brlabs nas/_rang gi lus las 'od zer gyis mkha' 'gro🔽ma'i gzugs su spros pas de rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa bkug pa dang de'i
analyzed: 'khor du brjod par bya'o/_/pad+ma 'bar ma ni ma ma ki lta bu'o/_/go cha la sogs par byin gyis brlabs nas/_rang gi lus las 'od zer gyis mkha' 'gro ma'i gzugs su spros pas de rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa bkug pa dang de'i
translated: Blazing Lotus is like Mamaki.🔽After blessing the armor and so on, light rays from one’s body emanate in the forms of dakinis.

original: sku las 'od zer las byung ba'i lha mo rnams kyis bum pa'i phyag gis bdag nyid
analyzed: sku las 'od zer las byung ba'i lha mo rnams kyis bum pa'i phyag gis bdag nyid
translated: Those [dakinis] summon the tathagatas, and goddesses arisen from light rays from their bodies anoint one’s head with vases in their hands.

original: dbang skur te/_mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lngas ral pa'i🔽cod pan la brgyan pa yin no/_/de nas mdun la sogs pa'i thod pa rnams la/
analyzed: dbang skur te/_mi bskyod pa la sogs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa lngas ral pa'i cod pan la brgyan pa yin no/_/de nas mdun la sogs pa'i thod pa rnams la/
translated: They are adorned with crowns of the five Tathagatas, Akshobhya and so forth.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i lha rnams kyi tshhogs bsam par bya'o/_/🔽mdun du thod par zla ba la rgyu las byung ba'i rnam par snang mdzad dkar zhing zhi
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i lha rnams kyi tshhogs bsam par bya'o/_/ mdun du thod par zla ba la rgyu las byung ba'i rnam par snang mdzad dkar zhing zhi
translated: Then, in the skull cups in front and so forth, one should imagine the assemblies of the deities of Vairochana and so forth.

original: ba phyag bzhi pa/_g.yas dang g.yon na 'khor lo dang dril bu dang thod pa🔽dang zhags pa 'dzin par bsgom par bya'o/_/g.yas su thod par zla ba la am las🔽byung ba'i rin chen 'byung gnas ser po phyag bzhi pa/_g.yas pa la sogs pa ni/
analyzed: ba phyag bzhi pa/_g.yas dang g.yon na 'khor lo dang dril bu dang thod pa dang zhags pa 'dzin par bsgom par bya'o/_/g.yas su thod par zla ba la am las byung ba'i rin chen 'byung gnas ser po phyag bzhi pa/_g.yas pa la sogs pa ni/
translated: In the skull cup in front, upon a moon, is white Vairochana, arisen from the seed syllable BHRUM. He is peaceful and has four faces. In his right and left hands he holds a wheel, a bell, a skull cup and a lasso.

original: rin po che dang lcags kyu dang thod pa dang zhags pa 'dzin pa'o/_/nub tu thod
analyzed: rin po che dang lcags kyu dang thod pa dang zhags pa 'dzin pa'o/_/nub tu thod
translated: In the skull cup to the right, upon a moon, is yellow Ratnasambhava, arisen from the seed syllable AM. His right and left hands hold a jewel, a hook, a skull cup and a lasso.

original: par zla ba la hrilas byung ba'i pad+ma gar gyi dbang phyug sku mdog dmar po phyag
analyzed: par zla ba la hrilas byung ba'i pad+ma gar gyi dbang phyug sku mdog dmar po phyag
translated: In the skull cup to the west, upon a moon, is red Padmanateśvara, arisen from the seed syllable HRĪH.🔽He holds a lotus, a sword, a skull cup and a lasso.

original: bzhi pa/_g.yas pa la sogs pa'i phyag na mda' dang pad+ma dang gzhu dang zhags🔽pa 'dzin pa'o/_/byang du thod par zla ba la kham las byung ba'i rta mchog sku🔽mdog ljang khu phyag bzhi pa/_g.yas pa la sogs pa na rdo rje dang lcags kyu dang
analyzed: bzhi pa/_g.yas pa la sogs pa'i phyag na mda' dang pad+ma dang gzhu dang zhags pa 'dzin pa'o/_/byang du thod par zla ba la kham las byung ba'i rta mchog sku mdog ljang khu phyag bzhi pa/_g.yas pa la sogs pa na rdo rje dang lcags kyu dang
translated: The four right hands hold an arrow, lotus, bow, and noose.🔽In the north, on a moon in a skull cup, is a supreme horse arising from kham, green, with four hands.🔽The right hands hold a vajra, iron hook,

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i rnam par 'grel pa'i bshad sbyar zhes bya ba
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i rnam par 'grel pa'i bshad sbyar zhes bya ba
translated: and chakram, and the left hands hold a bell, skull cup,🔽and lasso.

original: dril bu dang thod pa 'dzin pa'o/_/de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni ral pa'i🔽cod pan can zhal gcig pa'o/_/dbang ldan du thod par zla ba la rgyu las byung
analyzed: dril bu dang thod pa 'dzin pa'o/_/de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad ni ral pa'i cod pan can zhal gcig pa'o/_/dbang ldan du thod par zla ba la rgyu las byung
translated: All the tathagatas have topknotted crowns and one face.🔽In the northeast, on a moon in a skull cup, is Locana arising from dhrum, white, with three eyes,

original: ba'i spyan ma dkar mo spyan gsum ma/_zhal gcig ma thod pa'i phreng bas ral pa
analyzed: ba'i spyan ma dkar mo spyan gsum ma/_zhal gcig ma thod pa'i phreng bas ral pa
translated: one face, and a topknot adorned with a garland of skulls.

original: brgyan par mdzad pa/_phyag brgyad ma 'khor lo dang rdo rje dang ral gri dang mda' dang /_thod pa dang dril bu dang zhags pa dang gzhu 'dzin par bsgom
analyzed: brgyan par mdzad pa/_phyag brgyad ma 'khor lo dang rdo rje dang ral gri dang mda' dang /_thod pa dang dril bu dang zhags pa dang gzhu 'dzin par bsgom
translated: She is meditated on as having eight hands, holding a chakram, vajra, sword, arrow, skull cup, bell, lasso, and bow.

original: par bya'o/_/mer ni thod par zla ba la hum las ma ma ki sngon mo spyan gsum ma zhal
analyzed: par bya'o/_/mer ni thod par zla ba la hum las ma ma ki sngon mo spyan gsum ma zhal
translated: In the fire maṇḍala, on a moon in a skull cup, blue Māmakī arises from hūṃ. She has three eyes,

original: gcig ma thod pa'i phreng bas ral pa'i cod pan brgyan par mdzad pa phyag bcu
analyzed: gcig ma thod pa'i phreng bas ral pa'i cod pan brgyan par mdzad pa phyag bcu
translated: one face, and a topknot adorned with a garland of skulls. She has twelve hands,🔽holding an arrow, sword, vajra, chakram, jewel, lotus, bow, and goad in the right hands, and a bell, lasso, skull cup, and khaṭvāṅga in the left hands.

original: gnyis ma g.yas dang g.yon na mda' dang ral gri dang rdo rje dang 'khor lo dang / rin po che dang pad+ma dang gzhu dang lcags kyu dang /_dril bu dang zhags pa dang thod pa dang kha tam ga 'dzin ma'o/_/bden bral du thod par zla ba la hrilas byung🔽ba'i gos dkar mo thod pa'i cod pan brgyan par mdzad ma/_sku mdog dmar
analyzed: gnyis ma g.yas dang g.yon na mda' dang ral gri dang rdo rje dang 'khor lo dang / rin po che dang pad+ma dang gzhu dang lcags kyu dang /_dril bu dang zhags pa dang thod pa dang kha tam ga 'dzin ma'o/_/bden bral du thod par zla ba la hrilas byung ba'i gos dkar mo thod pa'i cod pan brgyan par mdzad ma/_sku mdog dmar
translated: In the northeast, in a skull cup on a moon, white Pāṇḍaravāsinī arises from hriṃ. She is adorned with a skull topknot.

original: po phyag brgyad kyis spras pa/_g.yas pa la sogs pa na mda' dang pad+ma dang ral
analyzed: po phyag brgyad kyis spras pa/_g.yas pa la sogs pa na mda' dang pad+ma dang ral
translated: Her body is red and she is adorned with eight hands, holding an arrow, lotus, sword,

original: gri dang rdo rje dang gzhu dang /_thod pa dang zhags pa dang dril bu 'dzin pa'o/_/
analyzed: gri dang rdo rje dang gzhu dang /_thod pa dang zhags pa dang dril bu 'dzin pa'o/_/
translated: vajra, bow, skull cup, lasso, and bell.

original: rlung du thod par zla ba la tam las byung ba'i sgrol ma sku mdog ljang gu spyan gsum ma🔽phyag brgyad ma g.yas pa la sogs pa na ut+pa la dmar po dang ral gri dang lcags
analyzed: rlung du thod par zla ba la tam las byung ba'i sgrol ma sku mdog ljang gu spyan gsum ma phyag brgyad ma g.yas pa la sogs pa na ut+pa la dmar po dang ral gri dang lcags
translated: In the wind maṇḍala, in a skull cup on a moon in the east, green Tārā arises from tam. She has three eyes.

original: kyu dang mda' dang 'khor lo dang zhags pa dang thod pa dang gzhu 'dzin ma bsgom🔽par bya'o/_/de nas 'phar ma gnyis pa la mdun du thod par zla ba la am las🔽skyes pa'i rdo rje drag mo phyag bzhi pa g.yas pa la sogs pa na/_mda' dang lcags
analyzed: kyu dang mda' dang 'khor lo dang zhags pa dang thod pa dang gzhu 'dzin ma bsgom par bya'o/_/de nas 'phar ma gnyis pa la mdun du thod par zla ba la am las skyes pa'i rdo rje drag mo phyag bzhi pa g.yas pa la sogs pa na/_mda' dang lcags
translated: She has eight arms. In the right hands she holds a red utpala, a sword, a goad, an arrow, a chakram, a noose, a skull cup, and a bow.

original: kyu dang gzhu dang khu bas gang ba'i thod pa 'dzin ma'o/_/g.yas su thod par zla
analyzed: kyu dang gzhu dang khu bas gang ba'i thod pa 'dzin ma'o/_/g.yas su thod par zla
translated: In the second tier, in front, in a skull cup on a moon in the east, Vajra Caṇḍī arises from aṃ. She has four faces and four hands. In the right hands she holds an arrow, a goad, a bow, and a skull cup filled with blood.

original: ba la am las skyes pa'i rdo rje gzugs can ma phyag bzhi pa g.yas pa la sogs pa na/
analyzed: ba la am las skyes pa'i rdo rje gzugs can ma phyag bzhi pa g.yas pa la sogs pa na/
translated: In the south, in a skull cup on a moon, Vajra Rūpiṇī arises from aṃ. She has four faces and four hands.

original: rdo rje dang mdung thung dang zhags pa dang /_khrag gis gang ba'i thod pa 'dzin
analyzed: rdo rje dang mdung thung dang zhags pa dang /_khrag gis gang ba'i thod pa 'dzin
translated: In the right hands she holds a vajra, a javelin, a noose, and a skull cup filled with blood.

original: ma'o/_/nub tu thod par zla ba la i las skyes pa'i rdo rje 'dod chags ma phyag
analyzed: ma'o/_/nub tu thod par zla ba la i las skyes pa'i rdo rje 'dod chags ma phyag
translated: In the west, in a skull cup on a moon, is a vajra arisen from i, Desire Vajrī.

original: bzhi pa g.yas pa la sogs pa na ral gri dang rdo rje dang chu yis gang ba'i thod pa
analyzed: bzhi pa g.yas pa la sogs pa na ral gri dang rdo rje dang chu yis gang ba'i thod pa
translated: She is four-faced and four-handed, holding a sword, a vajra, a skull cup filled with water,🔽and a bell.

original: dang dril bu 'dzin ma'o/_/byang du thod par zla ba la i las skyes pa'i rdo rje zhi ba
analyzed: dang dril bu 'dzin ma'o/_/byang du thod par zla ba la i las skyes pa'i rdo rje zhi ba
translated: In the north, in a skull cup on a moon, is a vajra arisen from i, Pacifier Vajrī.

original: ma phyag bzhi pa g.yas pa la sogs pa na gtun shing gi 'phan dang /_rdo rje dang ral gri dang thod pa 'dzin mar bsgom par bya'o/_/'di dag rim pa ji ltar
analyzed: ma phyag bzhi pa g.yas pa la sogs pa na gtun shing gi 'phan dang /_rdo rje dang ral gri dang thod pa 'dzin mar bsgom par bya'o/_/'di dag rim pa ji ltar
translated: She is four-faced and four-handed, holding a club banner, a vajra, a sword, and a skull cup.

original: dkar po dang ser po dang dmar po dang ljang gu'o dbang ldan du thod par zla ba🔽la u las skyes pa'i rdo rje gnod sbyin mo phyag bzhi pa g.yas pa la sogs pa na rdo rje
analyzed: dkar po dang ser po dang dmar po dang ljang gu'o dbang ldan du thod par zla ba la u las skyes pa'i rdo rje gnod sbyin mo phyag bzhi pa g.yas pa la sogs pa na rdo rje
translated: They are white, yellow, red, and green, respectively.🔽In the northeast, in a skull cup on a moon, is a vajra arisen from u, Yakṣa Vajrī.🔽She is four-faced and four-handed, holding a vajra, a plow, a skull cup, and a small drum.

original: dang nga la dang thod pa dang cang te 'dzin ma'o/_/mer ni thod par zla ba la khru
analyzed: dang nga la dang thod pa dang cang te 'dzin ma'o/_/mer ni thod par zla ba la khru
translated: In the southeast, in a skull cup on a moon, is a vajra arisen from ḍa, Destroyer Vajrī.

original: las skyes :rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma phyag bzhi pa g.yas pa la sogs pa na pad+ma dang me🔽long dang tshhil bus gang ba'i thod pa dang dgra sta 'dzin ma'o/_/bden bral du🔽thod par zla ba la am las skyes pa'i sgra'i rdo rje ma phyag bzhi pa g.yas pa la sogs pa
analyzed: las skyes :rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma phyag bzhi pa g.yas pa la sogs pa na pad+ma dang me long dang tshhil bus gang ba'i thod pa dang dgra sta 'dzin ma'o/_/bden bral du thod par zla ba la am las skyes pa'i sgra'i rdo rje ma phyag bzhi pa g.yas pa la sogs pa
translated: The dakini of the vajra family is born from the syllable om. She is white in color and holds a lotus, a mirror, a skull cup filled with fire, and an axe.

original: na 'phang mdung dang dung dang 'khor lo dang khrag gis gang ba'i thod pa 'dzin🔽ma'o/_/rlung du thod par zla ba la ahlas skyes pa'i sa'i rdo rje ma phyag bzhi pa/🔽g.yas pa la sogs pa na bum pa dang rdo rje dang rdzas kyis gang ba'i skyes pa'i
analyzed: na 'phang mdung dang dung dang 'khor lo dang khrag gis gang ba'i thod pa 'dzin ma'o/_/rlung du thod par zla ba la ahlas skyes pa'i sa'i rdo rje ma phyag bzhi pa/ g.yas pa la sogs pa na bum pa dang rdo rje dang rdzas kyis gang ba'i skyes pa'i
translated: In the southwest, in a skull cup on a moon, the dakini of sound is born from the syllable am. She is white in color and holds a spear, a conch, a chakram, and a skull cup filled with blood.🔽In the northwest, in a skull cup on a moon, the dakini of earth is born from the syllable ah. She is green in color and holds a vase, a vajra, a skull cup covered with the skin of a man filled with substances, and a bell.

original: pags pas bkab ba'i thod pa dang dril bu 'dzin ma'o/_/'di dag rim pa ji
analyzed: pags pas bkab ba'i thod pa dang dril bu 'dzin ma'o/_/'di dag rim pa ji
translated: These four dakinis are in pairs, each with two faces and four arms.

original: lta bar dkar ser dang dmar ser dang sngo dmar dang ljang skya ste kha dog gnyis
analyzed: lta bar dkar ser dang dmar ser dang sngo dmar dang ljang skya ste kha dog gnyis
translated: They are white, yellow, red, and green in color.

original: gnyis dang ldan pa'o/_/'phar ma gsum pa la mdun du thod par zla ba la rim
analyzed: gnyis dang ldan pa'o/_/'phar ma gsum pa la mdun du thod par zla ba la rim
translated: In front, in a skull cup on a moon, from raṃ arises the maiden of grace,

original: pas skyes pa'i sgeg mo g.yon pa rked par gnas pa g.yas pa gar gyi tshhul gyi lag
analyzed: pas skyes pa'i sgeg mo g.yon pa rked par gnas pa g.yas pa gar gyi tshhul gyi lag
translated: her left hand resting on her hip, her right hand in the gesture of dancing.

original: pa'o/_/g.yas su thod par zla ba la r-i las skyes pa'i phreng ba ma lag pa gnyis
analyzed: pa'o/_/g.yas su thod par zla ba la r-i las skyes pa'i phreng ba ma lag pa gnyis
translated: To the right, in a skull cup on a moon, from ri arises the maiden of the garland,🔽her two hands holding a garland.

original: kyis phreng ba 'dzin ma'o/_/nub tu thod par zla ba la l-i las skyes pa'i glu ma glu yis
analyzed: kyis phreng ba 'dzin ma'o/_/nub tu thod par zla ba la l-i las skyes pa'i glu ma glu yis
translated: To the rear, in a skull cup on a moon, from li arises the maiden of song,

original: gang ba'i khar lag pa gnyis kyis rim pas kha 'gebs par byed pa'o/_/byang du🔽rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i rnam par 'grel pa'i bshad sbyar zhes bya ba/
analyzed: gang ba'i khar lag pa gnyis kyis rim pas kha 'gebs par byed pa'o/_/byang du rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i rnam par 'grel pa'i bshad sbyar zhes bya ba/
translated: her two hands covering her mouth as she sings.🔽To the left, in a skull cup on a moon, from la arises the maiden of dance,

original: thod par zla ba la lo las skyes pa'i gar ma lag pa gnyis gar gyis brel ba'o/_/
analyzed: thod par zla ba la lo las skyes pa'i gar ma lag pa gnyis gar gyis brel ba'o/_/
translated: her two hands busy with dance.

original: 'di rnams rim pa ji lta bas rdo rje drag mo la sogs pa'i kha dog go/_/me la
analyzed: 'di rnams rim pa ji lta bas rdo rje drag mo la sogs pa'i kha dog go/_/me la
translated: These are the colors of Vajravetālī and so forth, in order.

original: sogs pa'i thod pa'i zla ba rnams la om om i i zhes bya ba'i sa bon las skyes pa'i
analyzed: sogs pa'i thod pa'i zla ba rnams la om om i i zhes bya ba'i sa bon las skyes pa'i
translated: The seed syllables oṃ oṃ i i arise from the moon discs in the skull cups of the first group.

original: gling bu ma dang pi bang ma dang mu kun da dang rdza rnga ma ni rim pa ji lta bas lha mo🔽rnams phyag gnyis kyis rang gi ming gi mtshhan ma 'dzin ma rim pa ji lta bar rdo rje
analyzed: gling bu ma dang pi bang ma dang mu kun da dang rdza rnga ma ni rim pa ji lta bas lha mo rnams phyag gnyis kyis rang gi ming gi mtshhan ma 'dzin ma rim pa ji lta bar rdo rje
translated: The flute player, lute player, mukunda, and clay drum player goddesses are goddesses🔽holding the insignia of their names with their two hands, such as a flute, lute, mukunda, and clay drum, respectively.

original: drag mo la sogs pa'i kha dog go/_/'phar ma bzhi pa'i snam bu la me la sogs
analyzed: drag mo la sogs pa'i kha dog go/_/'phar ma bzhi pa'i snam bu la me la sogs
translated: They are Vajra Vetālī and so on, in color order.

original: pa'i thod par zla ba rnams la rim pa ji lta bar sgeg mo la sogs pa'i sa bon las
analyzed: pa'i thod par zla ba rnams la rim pa ji lta bar sgeg mo la sogs pa'i sa bon las
translated: On the fourth tier, in skull cups on fire and so on, the seed syllables of the goddesses such as Lāsyā arise from moon discs.

original: skyes pa rdo rje drag mo la sogs pa'i mdog ma/_me tog ma dang bdug pa ma dang / mar me ma dang dri ma rnams rang gi ming gi mtshhan ma 'dzin ma/_phyag gnyis ma'o//
analyzed: skyes pa rdo rje drag mo la sogs pa'i mdog ma/_me tog ma dang bdug pa ma dang / mar me ma dang dri ma rnams rang gi ming gi mtshhan ma 'dzin ma/_phyag gnyis ma'o//
translated: They are Vajra Vetālī and so on, in color order. The flower goddess, incense goddess, lamp goddess, and scent goddess hold the insignia of their names with their two hands.

original: 'di rnams rdo rje drag mo la sogs pa nas dri ma'i mthar ral pa'i cod pan dang brgyan thams cad 'dzin ma'o/_/rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i lha rnams
analyzed: 'di rnams rdo rje drag mo la sogs pa nas dri ma'i mthar ral pa'i cod pan dang brgyan thams cad 'dzin ma'o/_/rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i lha rnams
translated: The deities of Vairocana and so on

original: ni skyil krung phyed pa'i gar gyis bzhugs pa dang /_nyi ma'i 'od dang gos bzang🔽po can no/_/g.yas pa la sogs pa'i sgor thod par sna tshhogs pad+ma nyi ma'i dkyil
analyzed: ni skyil krung phyed pa'i gar gyis bzhugs pa dang /_nyi ma'i 'od dang gos bzang po can no/_/g.yas pa la sogs pa'i sgor thod par sna tshhogs pad+ma nyi ma'i dkyil
translated: are seated in the half-dance posture, with the radiance of the sun and wearing fine clothes.🔽At the eastern gate and so on, in the skull cups on the variegated lotuses and sun maṇḍalas,

original: 'khor rnams la rim pas dzahlas skyes pa'i rdo rje lcags kyu ma zhal gsum ma nam
analyzed: 'khor rnams la rim pas dzahlas skyes pa'i rdo rje lcags kyu ma zhal gsum ma nam
translated: the vajra hook born from jaḥ is a three-faced,🔽sky-blue, black, and white woman.

original: mkha'i sngo bsangs ma dang nag mo dang dkar mo ste/_rtsha ba dang g.yas pa dang g.yon pa'o/_/phyag drug pa g.yas pa la sogs pa na lcags kyu dang ral gri dang 'khor lo dang zhags pa dang sdigs mdzub dang dril bu 'dzin pa'o/_/hum las
analyzed: mkha'i sngo bsangs ma dang nag mo dang dkar mo ste/_rtsha ba dang g.yas pa dang g.yon pa'o/_/phyag drug pa g.yas pa la sogs pa na lcags kyu dang ral gri dang 'khor lo dang zhags pa dang sdigs mdzub dang dril bu 'dzin pa'o/_/hum las
translated: The six arms hold a hook, a sword, a chakram, a lasso, a threatening gesture, and a bell.🔽From hūṃ, the vajra noose is a three-faced,

original: skyes pa'i rdo rje zhags pa ma ni phyag drug pa dkar ser lta bu dang dkar min ser🔽ba lta bu dang nag po dang dmar po'o/_/rtsha ba dang g.yas pa dang g.yon pa'i🔽zhal gsum pa zhags pa dang rdo rje dang ral gri dang 'khor lo dang dril bu dang sdigs mdzub kyis gzung pa'i zhags pa 'dzin ma'o/_/bam las skyes pa'i rdo rje🔽lcags sgrog ma phyag drug ma dmar po dang dmar po'i mdog dang dmar nag dang dkar po ni rtsha ba dang g.yas pa dang g.yon pa'i zhal gsum pa g.yas pa la sogs
analyzed: skyes pa'i rdo rje zhags pa ma ni phyag drug pa dkar ser lta bu dang dkar min ser ba lta bu dang nag po dang dmar po'o/_/rtsha ba dang g.yas pa dang g.yon pa'i zhal gsum pa zhags pa dang rdo rje dang ral gri dang 'khor lo dang dril bu dang sdigs mdzub kyis gzung pa'i zhags pa 'dzin ma'o/_/bam las skyes pa'i rdo rje lcags sgrog ma phyag drug ma dmar po dang dmar po'i mdog dang dmar nag dang dkar po ni rtsha ba dang g.yas pa dang g.yon pa'i zhal gsum pa g.yas pa la sogs
translated: The white, yellow, black, and red faces of Vajra-noose Lady are the right, left, and central faces. She holds a noose, vajra, sword, chakram, bell, and threatening mudra with a noose.🔽Vajra-chain Lady, born from vaṃ, is red, and her red, black, and white faces are the right, left, and central faces. She holds a chain, vajra, sword, chakram, bell, and goad.

original: pa na lcags sgrog dang rdo rje dang ral gri dang 'khor lo dang dril bu dang lcags kyu🔽rnams kyis brgyan par byas pa'o/_/hoh_las skyes pa'i rdo rje dril bu ma ni phyag
analyzed: pa na lcags sgrog dang rdo rje dang ral gri dang 'khor lo dang dril bu dang lcags kyu🔽rnams kyis brgyan par byas pa'o/_/hoh_las skyes pa'i rdo rje dril bu ma ni phyag
translated: Vajra-bell Lady, born from hoḥ, is white, and her white, yellow, black, and red faces are the right, left, and central faces. She holds a bell, vajra, sword, chakram, and lasso.

original: drug pa ljang gu dang nag mo dang dkar po ste/_rtsha ba dang g.yas dang g.yon gyi
analyzed: drug pa ljang gu dang nag mo dang dkar po ste/_rtsha ba dang g.yas dang g.yon gyi
translated: The sixth face is green, the seventh is black, and the eighth is white.🔽The three faces on the right are red, the three on the left are white, and the three on the front are black.

original: zhal gsum pa rdo rje dang ral gri dang 'khor lo dang dril bu dang lcags kyu dang zhags pa 'dzin pa'o/_/'di rnams ni skra ser po gyen du 'bar ba/_g.yas
analyzed: zhal gsum pa rdo rje dang ral gri dang 'khor lo dang dril bu dang lcags kyu dang zhags pa 'dzin pa'o/_/'di rnams ni skra ser po gyen du 'bar ba/_g.yas
translated: He holds a vajra, sword, chakram, bell, iron hook, and lasso.🔽Their hair is yellow and stands upward.

original: brkyang bas bzhugs pa nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'od can stag gi pags pa'i
analyzed: brkyang bas bzhugs pa nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'od can stag gi pags pa'i
translated: They stand with the right leg straight and are adorned with the light of the sun.

original: shams mnabs pa/_phyag rgya drug gis rnam par brgyan ma'o/_/de nas dzahhum bam🔽hoh_zhes brjod pas rdo rje lcags kyu ma la sogs pa rnams kyis ye shes kyi 'khor lo
analyzed: shams mnabs pa/_phyag rgya drug gis rnam par brgyan ma'o/_/de nas dzahhum bam hoh_zhes brjod pas rdo rje lcags kyu ma la sogs pa rnams kyis ye shes kyi 'khor lo
translated: They wear tiger-skin skirts and are adorned with the six symbolic ornaments.

original: dgug pa dang gzhug pa dang bcing ba dang dbang du yang byed do/_/go cha gnyis🔽kyi lha thams cad kyi tshhogs kyi yan lag la dgos pa byas nas de bzhin gshegs pa
analyzed: dgug pa dang gzhug pa dang bcing ba dang dbang du yang byed do/_/go cha gnyis kyi lha thams cad kyi tshhogs kyi yan lag la dgos pa byas nas de bzhin gshegs pa
translated: Then, by reciting “jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ,” the vajra hook and so forth summon, induct, bind, and control the gnosis wheel.🔽Having performed the necessary branches of the assembly of deities of the two armor [offerings], all tathāgatas bestow empowerment.

original: thams cad kyis dbang bskur byin te/_de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i cod pan du
analyzed: thams cad kyis dbang bskur byin te/_de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i cod pan du
translated: The five tathāgatas are placed on the crown.

analyzed: lcags sgrog ma'i 'o/_/om /_badzra g+han+ne hoh_ham swa ha zhes bya ba ni rdo rje dril bu ma'i

analyzed: 'o/_/sngags kyi tshhogs 'dis dkyil 'khor gyi bstod pa byas nas/_de rnams

analyzed: bdud rtshi lnga po des mchod par bya'o/_/de nas yang gtum mo'i rnal 'byor gyi

analyzed: mthar sngags bzla bar bya ste/_om ma ha su kha zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sngags

analyzed: bzlas/_zhes bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'i sgom pa'i cho ga'o/_/

analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su rdo rje sems dpa' bsam par

original: bya'o/_/dmar zhing 'bar 'khyil zhes bya ba ni nyi ma'i 'od zer ro/_/sangs🔽rgyas phreng bas rnam par spras zhes bya ba ni mi bskyod pa la sogs pa de bzhin

analyzed: gshegs pa lnga yis cod pan brgyan pa'o/_/lhag ma go sla'o/_/rig ma bzhi
translated: “Adorned with a garland of buddhas” is the crown ornament of the five tathāgatas, Akṣobhya, and so on. The rest is easy to understand.🔽The four knowledge consorts are the four goddesses in the four intermediate directions.

analyzed: dang zhes bya ba ni spyan la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams so/_/sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni

analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o/_/g.yas pa dkar min zhi ba dang zhes bya ba
translated: refers to Vairocana and so forth. “The right face is peaceful and not white”

analyzed: la dkar po'i sgras ni skye bo ste nag po zhes bya bar brjod do/_/'di la dkar

analyzed: po'i sgra'i tshhig skye bo zhes bya bar blo la brtan par byas nas de las bzlog pa zhal

analyzed: nag po zhes bya bar brjod do/_/g.yas pa'i zhal zhi ba'i phyir gzhan pa rnams kyi
translated: of that is expressed as “black.” Because the right face is peaceful, the other

analyzed: ni rnam par gtshigs pa'o/_/'di nyid kyi phyir sum cu rtsha gsum pa 'jigs par

analyzed: mdzad pa'o/_/mkha' 'gro'i 'khor lo zhes bya ba ni rdo rje drag mo la sogs pa'o/_/
translated: “The circle of ḍākinīs” refers to Vajravetālī and so forth.🔽“The protector”

analyzed: skyob pa pos ni sna tshhogs zhes bya ba ni gzugs sna tshhogs pas rang gi sku las spros
translated: means that, through various forms, he emanates from his own body.

original: pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis mtshhon to/_/bcom ldan 'das dang bdag
analyzed: pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis mtshhon to/_/bcom ldan 'das dang bdag

analyzed: dbyer med par bsgom par bya'o zhes bya bar dgongs so/_/yang na skyob pa pos

original: ni sna tshhogs shes bya ba ni yud tsham gyis ri rab la gzhal med khang la sogs pa'i
analyzed: ni sna tshhogs shes bya ba ni yud tsham gyis ri rab la gzhal med khang la sogs pa'i

analyzed: dbus su bzhugs pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs su bdag nyid bsgom pa'am/

translated: Or, by generating him, I should meditate on myself as the form of Vajrasattva.🔽If one who is not established is made established, he would not be established,

original: 'gyur te/_sngon du mngon par 'du ma byas pa'i phyir na/_'dus ma byas pa ni🔽rang nyid 'khor bar 'khor ba'i phyir/_de ji ltar 'dus byas pa'i gzugs su
analyzed: 'gyur te/_sngon du mngon par 'du ma byas pa'i phyir na/_'dus ma byas pa ni rang nyid 'khor bar 'khor ba'i phyir/_de ji ltar 'dus byas pa'i gzugs su
translated: because he is not previously compounded.🔽Since the uncompounded itself cycles in saṃsāra,🔽how is it proper to emanate it as a compounded form?

original: sprul par rigs/_de ni rang bzhin gyis grub pa ste/_so so skye bo'i spyod yul
analyzed: sprul par rigs/_de ni rang bzhin gyis grub pa ste/_so so skye bo'i spyod yul
translated: That is naturally established.

original: ni ma yin te gzugs su brtags pa des gzhan rnam par dag par bskyed par
analyzed: ni ma yin te gzugs su brtags pa des gzhan rnam par dag par bskyed par
translated: It is not so, because by means of the investigation of form, the other is generated as pure.

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i rnam par 'grel pa'i bshad sbyar zhes bya ba
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro'i rnam par 'grel pa'i bshad sbyar zhes bya ba
translated: The commentary called the Vajradaka-vyakhya

original: bya'o/_/rnam par dag pas ni rnam par dag par bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni
analyzed: bya'o/_/rnam par dag pas ni rnam par dag par bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni
translated: The pure is to be accomplished by means of the pure. This is the instruction.

original: man ngag go/_/'di ltar yang rgyu las ris mthun pa'i 'bras bu thams cad du
analyzed: man ngag go/_/'di ltar yang rgyu las ris mthun pa'i 'bras bu thams cad du
translated: Thus, all effects of the same type as the cause are definitely seen.

original: nges par mthong ste/_phal cher ni ris mthun pa nyid kyis ris mthun pa skyes
analyzed: nges par mthong ste/_phal cher ni ris mthun pa nyid kyis ris mthun pa skyes
translated: For the most part, the same type generates the same type,

analyzed: par byed de/_gzhan du na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro/_/'bras bu'i ris mthun pa'ang de nyid kyis skyes par byed par nges shing /_rgyu'i ris mthun pas
translated: otherwise there would be an absurd consequence.

original: de nyid kyis bskyed par byed pa por nges pa'ang nus par 'gyur ro/_/ji srid
analyzed: de nyid kyis bskyed par byed pa por nges pa'ang nus par 'gyur ro/_/ji srid
translated: The same type of effect is definitely generated by that, and the same type of cause is definitely able to generate that.🔽As long as

analyzed: 'dus byas pa'ang rnam par ma dag pa ste mngon par 'du bya ba mngon par 'dod
translated: the compounded is impure, the manifest compositional activity is desired.

original: pa'i gzugs su dgod pa yang gzhan du 'gyur ro/_/gal te de ltar ni rang🔽bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa zhes bya bar ji ltar 'gyur te/_'dir mngon par
analyzed: pa'i gzugs su dgod pa yang gzhan du 'gyur ro/_/gal te de ltar ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa zhes bya bar ji ltar 'gyur te/_'dir mngon par
translated: If that were the case, then how could it be called “totally pure by nature”?🔽  Here, it is not that the nature of phenomena is not pure, but rather that it is not the case that the nature of phenomena is not impure.🔽

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan gyi dgod pa yang med par 'gyur ro/_/de lta mod kyi rang
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan gyi dgod pa yang med par 'gyur ro/_/de lta mod kyi rang
translated: The form of the deity would also be different. If that were so, how could it be called “naturally pure”? And the manifestation of the desired qualities would not exist here.

original: bzhin gyis grub pa nyid do/_/dper na 'o ma la sogs pa'i yon tan dkar po
analyzed: bzhin gyis grub pa nyid do/_/dper na 'o ma la sogs pa'i yon tan dkar po
translated: Nevertheless, it is established by nature. For example, the qualities of milk and so forth, such as its whiteness,

original: yod pa mngon par 'dod pa'i gzugs dang ldan pa'ang rnam par dag par brjod🔽cing glo bur ba'i gzugs son pa yang gsal bas rang gi gzugs gsal bar
analyzed: yod pa mngon par 'dod pa'i gzugs dang ldan pa'ang rnam par dag par brjod cing glo bur ba'i gzugs son pa yang gsal bas rang gi gzugs gsal bar
translated: are also said to be pure when they possess the desired form, and the manifestation of adventitious forms

original: 'gyur ro/_/'di nyid gzhan du na dngos po med par yang 'gyur ro/_/rnal
analyzed: 'gyur ro/_/'di nyid gzhan du na dngos po med par yang 'gyur ro/_/rnal
translated: is also clear, so its own form becomes clear. This is also different from non-existence.

original: 'byor pas gang zhig de ltar bsgom pa de ji lta bu zhe na/_kun ces bya ba la
analyzed: 'byor pas gang zhig de ltar bsgom pa de ji lta bu zhe na/_kun ces bya ba la
translated: What is it that the yogi meditates on in this way? “ All” and so forth is stated.

analyzed: sogs pa gsungs te yud tsham gyis ri rab la khang pa rtsheg ma la sogs par
translated: In an instant, on Mount Meru, in a house, on a particle, and so forth,

analyzed: bzhugs pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dang spyan la sogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i

analyzed: don to/_/bde ba'i mchog ces bya ba ni bde ba dam pa'i rnam pa ste/_'di

analyzed: yang dngos po'i khyad par ro/_/de skad ces bya ba la sogs pa ni sdud par byed

analyzed: pas rang rgyud spangs pa'o/_/ji lta bu zhe na smras pa/_de bzhin gshegs zhes

analyzed: gsungs te/_de bzhin blo la gnas par byas nas/_phyin ci ma log par

analyzed: dang dbyibs kyis don dam par ma yin pa'i tshhul gyis phyag dang /_zhal la

analyzed: bshad par bya ste nyi ma'i stan la rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i 'gro ba sdom par byed pa ni

analyzed: gang la gnas she na gsungs pa/_bstan zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems te

analyzed: ha dang zla ba phyed pa thig le rnams ni gsum pa'o/_/gang ba zhes bya ba ni byas

translated: On the eastern spoke, in Pullīramalaya, is Caṇḍālī, embracing Kṣetrapāla.🔽On the northern spoke, in Jālandhara, is Carcikā, embracing Mahāśvetā.🔽On the western spoke, in Oḍḍiyāna, is Pukkasī, embracing Śāvarī.

translated: The essence of the mindfulness of body, speech, dharma, and mind is,🔽respectively, the one who causes falling, the one who causes killing, the

analyzed: dang gsod par byed ma dang 'gugs par byed ma dang /_gar gyi dbang phyug ma rnams so/_/'dun pa dang brtshon 'grus dang dpyod pa dang sems kyi rdzu 'phrul

translated: The essence of the faculty of wisdom is the nature of the goddesses of Great Fear, Small Belly, Ghasmarī, and Pukkasī.🔽The essence of the powers of faith, diligence, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom is the nature of the goddesses of Great Fear, Wind Speed, Ale Drinking, Blue Goddess, and Very Good.

translated: The essence of the branches of enlightenment of mindfulness, investigation of phenomena, diligence, joy, pliancy, concentration, and equanimity is the nature of the goddesses of Great Fear, Wind Speed, Ale Drinking, Blue Goddess, Very Good, Great Lotus, and Great Lady.

analyzed: dang rtog pa dang las kyi mtha' dang /_'tshho ba dang /_rtshol ba dang dran pa'i

analyzed: ka'o/_/dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams bskyed pa dang /_dge ba'i chos skyes

analyzed: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi bskyed pa'i rang bzhin ni rim pa ji lta bar
translated: The nature of protecting the virtues that have arisen, abandoning the nonvirtues that have arisen, and not producing the nonvirtues that have not yet arisen is, respectively,

analyzed: gshin rje'i mche ba ma dang /_gshin rje'i pho nya ma dang gshin rje mche ba gtshigs

analyzed: rna ba g.yas par 'do ldan ma'o/_//_/mgo bo'i rgyab tu sna chen ma ste gnas so/

analyzed: ba'i mchog sbyin rna ba g.yon par dpa' bo'i blo gros ma'o/_/dga' ba'i dbang

original: phat swa ha zhes bya ba ni 'di'i phyag rgya gnyis kyi sngags so/_/ye shes kyi mkha'
analyzed: phat swa ha zhes bya ba ni 'di'i phyag rgya gnyis kyi sngags so/_/ye shes kyi mkha'

analyzed: 'gro ma ni dam tshhig gi mkha' 'gro ma rnams la dzah_bam ba~m hoh_zhes bya bas gzhug pa

analyzed: la sogs pa byas nas sngags bzla bar bya'o/_/om badzra da ki ni bcu bcu pa ya hum

analyzed: b+hu swa ha zhes bya ba ni/_rdo rje mkha' 'gro ma'i sngags so/_/om g+hi li g+hi li zhes

analyzed: bya ba la sogs pas ni sprin rnams kyis 'di ltar char 'bebs par 'gyur ro/_/
translated: “Oṃ ghaṭi ghaṭi” and so forth are the clouds that cause rain to fall.

original: yang na phyag rgya ma byas par sngags bzlas par bya'o/_/mkha' 'gro thams cad🔽mnyam sbyor ba/_/rdo rje mkha' 'gro bde ba'i mchog ces bya ba ni go sla'o/_/rnal

analyzed: rje mkha' 'gro'i rnam par 'grel pa'i bshad sbyar zhes bya ba/

analyzed: dkyil 'khor gnyis kyi gru gsum rnams la klu bri bar bya'o/_/dkyil 'khor gyi
translated: In the middle of the maṇḍala, draw the eight hṛ in the directions and🔽the intermediate directions.🔽The “shape of the corners and hṛ in the directions” means that the

analyzed: can no/_/ri mo gsum gyis bskor ba ni/_mo dza zhes bya ba la sogs pa
translated: “Surrounded by three lines” is stated in “mo ja” and so on. The

translated: rest is easy to understand.🔽“Mustard seed” and so on: The perfect buddha is to be connected with

analyzed: dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ni rdo rje sems dpa' dang sbyar ro/_/dben pa

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skye bo dang bral ba'i gnas so/_/'dis ni 'di brjod de rdo rje
translated: “Isolated” means a place free of people. This is what is being said:

analyzed: sems dpa' yungs mar gyis byugs te brdungs la dbyen pa'i phyogs su bskam

analyzed: zhing rang yang de nyid du gnas te nga rgyal dang bcas par om a ka ro mu kham zhes bya

analyzed: ba la sogs pa'i sngags bzlas pas lha'i rgyal po char 'bebs par 'gyur ro/_/

analyzed: ji ltar bzlas she na/_kun ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so/_/rjes su

analyzed: 'brang zhes bya ba ni las kyi rdo rje ste/_gang gi rjes su 'brang ba kun zhes pa de ni

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal dang bcas pa'o/_/'dod pa zhes bya ba ni char ster ba'i

translated: “In the direction of giving water” is that which is slightly to the east of the mouth,🔽in the direction of Agni.🔽Here, if one asks, “Will Indra cause rain to fall?”🔽Indra and so forth are stated because it is taught that Indra causes rain to fall by becoming a cloud.

original: dbang po char 'bebs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro/_/gal te char mi 'bab na
analyzed: dbang po char 'bebs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro/_/gal te char mi 'bab na
translated: If it does not rain,

analyzed: de'i tshhe phyag na rdo rje'i sngags bzla bar bya'o/_/de nyid ni min na zhes bya ba la

analyzed: sogs pa gsungs te/_dpal phyag na rdo rje'i sngags te/_phyag na rdo rje ste

analyzed: sngags dang lha dag tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro/_/yang na don ji lta ba bzhin du des
translated: because the mantra and the deity are non-different.🔽Alternatively, the meaning is that by meditating and reciting it as it is,

analyzed: bsgom pa dang bzlas pas kyang sngags kyi gzugs kyis de char 'bebs so zhes bya

analyzed: byung ba phyag gnyis na/_rdo rje dang rdo rje dril bu 'dzin pa/_'dod pa'i
